programme.title: Racetrack 2024, Part 10
programme.desc: Get ready for an adrenaline-fueled ride as Racetrack brings you all the highlights from this year's European Truck Racing Championship.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Mitsubishi Outlander Plug-In Hybrid, the world's first hybrid SUV with two electric motors and a 2-liter combustion engine. Also: the Chevrolet Silverado, an American full-size pickup with a V8 and an average consumption of at least 15 liters.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Bentley EXP 9F and Jaguar C-X17 are concept cars the two manufacturers presented before they started making their own luxury SUVs. Also: how did Toyota, Nissan or Subaru see the future of the SUV? And: Mercedes-Benz' Unimog concept car.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The SUVs Nissan X-Trail and BMW X4 aren't typical offroaders. We witnessed the presentation of the new X-Trail model and BMW's premiere of their X4. Also: the Steinbeißer Trophy, where unusual offroad vehicles take part in a demanding rally.

programme.title: BMW M3
programme.desc: In the late 80s BMW brought a car onto the market which carried true racing genes. Initially conceived as a homologation model for the German Touring Car Championship, it developed into being one of the world's hottest street sports car. Whenever its name is mentioned, car fans feel goosebumps - even today: the BMW M3.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Volvo XC60
programme.desc: The Swedish landscape is characterized by mountains, forests and lonely roads. Ideal for this off-roader. The Volvo XC60 scores with many safety features and a cool appearance.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Winning the iconic Dakar Rally for a record 13 times, Frenchman Stéphane Peterhansel had a rather unusual career as he switched from motorbikes to cars and was enormously successful with both vehicles.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: Alois Ruf is the founder of a small, but well-known car manufacturing company in Bavaria that specialises in building their own vision of street legal super sports cars on the foundation of Porsche bodys.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: From the 1950s to 1970s Hans Herrmann came to fame as a successful Formula 1 and sportscar driver for manufacturers like Porsche, Mercedes-Benz and Maserati who also won also the 24 Hours of Le Mans several times.

programme.title: Motorheads
programme.desc: People called her the "Queen of the Nordschleife" when she used to drive her Porsche or BMW racing cars at the Nürburgring's famous Nordschleife. Sabine Schmitz was a successful racing driver before she took a career turn by working as a TV presenter.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new BMW One M Coupe from former race car driver Ralf Kelleners: the KS1 RS. Also: Toyota present their TS 030 hybrid at the 24-hours race of Le Mans. And: Subaru's XV crossover stands out from the company's model range.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The 'little' Mercedes-Benz S250 with a four-cylinder engine needs so little fuel that one could call this car a piggybank. Also: the power packages Nissan 370 Z and Wiesmann GT MF5. And: the ADAC Eco Test.

programme.title: Streetwise
programme.desc: The new Porsche Boxter, a real open-top sports car. Also: Volkswagen presents the new Passat Alltrack, a real allrounder. And: Fiat's successful Panda model in its third generation version.

programme.title: Mercedes Sprinter, 2018
programme.desc: The Mercedes Sprinter belongs to the class of commercial vehicles. The light transporter is the dream for every tradesman. The third generation Sprinter is sleeker, more modern and more variable than ever.

programme.title: Arden AJ23
programme.desc: A Jaguar that is able to terrify the world alone with its roar. This Jaguar F-Type R tuned by Arden is a real bad boy. Already in the series production configuration, the F-Type R Coupe is a dream car that can really bite but this Jaguar which has been upgraded from Arden, now calls itself "AJ23“ and is more powerful, louder and more aggressive than any of his brothers.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: The Nürburgring is the place where you can really let your hair down on a spectacular and difficult race track and learn how to get fit for motor sports. This is the reason why motoring enthusiasts go there throughout the year.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: We prepared some very entertaining clips from the Nürburgring for you. Expect to see the pedal on the metal and rubber burning.

programme.title: Trackmasters
programme.desc: When the weather cleared up a bit at the Nürburgring, we were finally back at the track. As soon as the snow and ice were gone the horsepower junkies returned to the ring to once again let their engines roar.

programme.title: Artega GT
programme.desc: From 2006 to 2012 the German company Artega produced their GT sports car model. Thanks to the know-how of a former Porsche and BMW manager the Artega GT was able to be manufactured in a small series.

programme.title: Ferrari California T
programme.desc: The Ferrari California T has a lot of Italian passion and elegant lines to offer. Super sports car cabriolets are popular all over the world. It is no wonder that more and more manufacturers are 'opening up'.

programme.title: Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 police car
programme.desc: This 1994 Chevrolet Caprice 9C1 is a former police car from the Los Angeles Police Department. Its curvaceous body was often mocked as looking like a whale, but this Chevy Caprice possesses the qualities of a shark.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.sub-title: All- Wheel- Drive on station wagons
programme.desc: The Skoda Octavia, the Opel Insignia Country Tourer, the Subaru Outback, the Audi S4 allroad quattro and the Seat Leon x-perience want to be more than roomy family cars. Their offroad features show that it doesn't always have to be an SUV.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: We present some of the more extreme specimens in the offroad world: a Fiat Panda monster truck, a Ford Raptor, a conversion of a Mercedes G-class Edition, a modified Volkswagen Touareg, a Jeep Grand Cherokee SRT8 and the Fiat Panda Cross.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.sub-title: Compact SUVs from the Far East
programme.desc: With its extravagant design the Lexus NX200t definitely stands out. Infiniti, Nissan's luxury division, is more conservative in that regard. The QX30 features a classic Infiniti design with a curved bonnet. Also: the city SUV Mazda CX-3.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: Three brothers from the same Volkswagen production platform: the Skoda Kodiaq provides room for seven people, the Volkswagen Tiguan is a bit more expensive but offers a broader range of engines, and Seat infuse the SUV segment with Spanish passion.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Jaguar XF-S is supposed to put pressure on BMW, Audi and the other competitors in the business class segment. Volvo take a different approach. Their S90 is captivating due to its Scandinavian design and economical four-cylinder engines.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: ORZ Vehicles, a German company specializing in the production, sale and installation of Jeep parts and accessories, makes the American off-road dream come true. A good example for this approach is the Brute, a pickup version of the Wrangler.

programme.title: 4x4
programme.desc: The Seat Arona is a typical compact or mini SUV. Another pseudo off-roader is the Volkswagen T-Roc. Can the smallest Volkswagen SUV repeat the success of the best-selling Tiguan? Also: the Asian competitors Hyundai Kona, KIA Stonic and Toyota C-HR.

programme.title: BMW F 800 R
programme.desc: BMW F 800 R is a robust roadster with a lot of spirit, and even motorcycle world champions count on its agility. World champion, Chris Pfeiffer is showing just how much fun you can have with a BMW F 800 R. His work motorcycle is based on the version that you can buy.

programme.title: Audi MTM S8 Talladega R
programme.desc: The Audi S8 Plus is by no means underpowered, but it is and remains faithful to this model series' understatement. Those who want more power can get a boost from MTM.

programme.title: Racetrack 2024, Part 10
programme.desc: Get ready for an adrenaline-fueled ride as Racetrack brings you all the highlights from this year's European Truck Racing Championship.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Ernest meets up with an old favourite from Honda. The Nissan Navara gets a host of off-road upgrades and Kumbi finds out if the plug-in hybrid is the pick of the BMW X5 range.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We find a VW Golf GTi alternative under R290 000. SUV’s from Mazda, Chery, Haval and VW come under the spotlight and we examine a Nissan NP200 with squeaky brake pads

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We’re in the small town of Bethlehem for the Maluti Motor show. Francisco is in Johannesburg finding out how one collection turned into a fleet of vehicles.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: There's fun, speed and challenges at the Festival of Motoring. What's the best way to kart, indoors or outdoors? A tuned BMW 330d is the latest Drag Kings hopeful. We swop horsepower for human power in the annual Bed Race and we showcase a Subaru WRX that's been tuned to the max.

programme.title: Lancia Delta S4
programme.desc: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, or so the saying goes. Technically the Delta S4 is the most lavishly designed race car. The S4 developed by Aurelio Lampredi and Claudio Lombardi is entered in 1986 as a successor to the Lancia Rally 037 in the Group B.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: The Bentley New Flying Spur and the Rolls Royce Wraith are both an extremely exclusive breed of cars. These luxurious power packs make for an almost transcendental driving experience and deliver the perfect combination of elegance and performance.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: There are names that sound like music in car enthusiasts' ears: the Mc Laren MP4 12C, the Porsche 911 Turbo S and the Mercedes SLS AMG GT are super sports cars that are second to none. We put the pedal to the metal in these exciting and powerful driving machines.

programme.title: Supercars
programme.desc: 1,000 kilometers on the famous Nurburgring. It's the final race of the 2013 season. The Blancpain Endurance Series is a racing event for grand tourers like the Ferrari 458 Italia, the McLaren MP4-12 C or the Nissan GT-R Nismo GT3. We took a look at all the action, the drivers, their cars and the competition.

programme.title: Mercedes 300 SL Lightweight
programme.desc: An iconic racing car and one of only 29 ever built! We accompanied the Mercedes 300 SL 'lightweight' on its premiere drive at the Mille Miglia.

programme.title: Bentley Bentayga
programme.desc: With the Bentley Bentayga, the traditional British brand is entering the fastest growing market segment. This world's first luxury SUV is a conglomerate of superlatives on wheels.

programme.title: Ignition GT
programme.desc: Ernest meets up with an old favourite from Honda. The Nissan Navara gets a host of off-road upgrades and Kumbi finds out if the plug-in hybrid is the pick of the BMW X5 range.

programme.title: Buyer's Guide
programme.desc: We find a VW Golf GTi alternative under R290 000. SUV’s from Mazda, Chery, Haval and VW come under the spotlight and we examine a Nissan NP200 with squeaky brake pads

programme.title: Garage Gold
programme.desc: We’re in the small town of Bethlehem for the Maluti Motor show. Francisco is in Johannesburg finding out how one collection turned into a fleet of vehicles.

programme.title: Petrolheads
programme.desc: There's fun, speed and challenges at the Festival of Motoring. What's the best way to kart, indoors or outdoors? A tuned BMW 330d is the latest Drag Kings hopeful. We swop horsepower for human power in the annual Bed Race and we showcase a Subaru WRX that's been tuned to the max.

programme.title: Lancia Delta S4
programme.desc: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, or so the saying goes. Technically the Delta S4 is the most lavishly designed race car. The S4 developed by Aurelio Lampredi and Claudio Lombardi is entered in 1986 as a successor to the Lancia Rally 037 in the Group B.

programme.title: FIA European Truck Racing Championship
programme.desc: The 2024 season of the European Truck Racing Championship kicks off in Misano, Italy, with new tyres and two new driver categories.
